result.execSummary:
The defendant Junius S Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endanger Safety/Reckless Use of Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable mandatory surcharges, fees, assessments and costs.  To be collected/paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds  under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  Any amount remaning due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other time being served.
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse program after serving the first two (2) years of this sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain full time employment or full time school and part time employment. Obtain high school diploma, GED or HSED.

No drug dealing or association with drug community, drug users/dealers or drug houses.
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with victim Felicia M.

Cooperate with any and all rules set forth by the probation agent.
Participate in anger  management program, and cognitive thinking program.
Pay all supervision fees.
Obtain AODA  assessment and if necessary successfully complete follow up treatment.  Cooperate with random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample, pay surcharge.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession, body armor possession and voting.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Junius S Moore

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (36 pages) commencing OCTOBER 28, 2014 received and filed. kl
from Alicia P. and Aleah B.-P.  with photos submitted on behalf of the defendant.
from defendant, received and filed.
State Subpoena
State Subpoena
State Subpoena

Attorney Patrick T. Earle in court, defendant Junius S Moore not in court, in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

The state informs the Court that witness Felicia M. was available on today if this matter proceeded to jury trial.  For reasons set forth by the state and on the state's motion, the Court ordered the body attachment for said witness withdrawn at this time.

Defendant Junius S Moore in court with attorney Patrick T. Earle.  Defendant Junius S Moore in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Jury trial.  State prepared to proceed to trial.   Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

AS TO COUNT 5:  The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint and oral modifications as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.  

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, 3, AND 4:  Pursuant to negotiations and on state's motion the Court ordered Counts 1, 2, 3, and 4 DISMISSED AND READ-IN for the purpose of sentencing for Count 5.

The Court orders the defendant REMANDED at this time.  

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Patrick T. Earle in court, defendant Junius S Moore not in court, in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Status conference as to jury date of 9-22-14.  The state and defense prepared to proceed to trial on Monday.  Case remains set for Jury Trial on 9-22-14 at 9:00 a.m. before Branch 21.

Attorney Patrick T. Earle in court, defendant Junius S Moore not in court, in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Jury trial.  Defense requests time to confer with his client.  Case passed until 1:30 p.m. as the parties have resumed settlement negotiations.


CASE RECALLED IN THE P.M.......SAME APPEARANCES.....

Parties no longer engaged in negotiations.  Defense in a contest posture.  Amended information filed by the state.  Defense objects.  Argument of the state and defense heard.  The Court grants the state leave to file amended information.  Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of a copy of the Amended Information, waived its reading and entered a plea of not guilty as to added charges on behalf of the defendant.  Defense motion for adjournment heard.  Issues as to adjournment and speedy trial demand addressed with the parties.  Argument of the parties heard.  For reasons set forth on the record by the Court new jury trial date selected with the parties.  Court to set status date to allow for the state to contact witnesses regarding availability.  Case set for Status conference on 9-19-14 at 8:30 a.m. and Jury Trial on 9-22-14 at 9:00 a.m. before Branch 21.
as to Junius S Moore.

Matter before the Court for Jury Trial.  Parties prepared to proceed.  State's motion for warrant heard.  Court having been advised that witness, Felicia M. had been subpoenaed and served on 9-12-14.  Subpoena filed.  Court ordered that a bench warrant be issued for the defaulting witness.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Motion to admit recording(s) proceeded.  Statement made by defense and the state.  The state has no objection as set forth on the record.  The Court grants defense motion.  Case remains set for Jury Trial on 9-17-14 at 9:00 a.m. before Branch 21.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Modification of Conditions of Bail, received and filed.  Motion to be heard on 9-03-14 at 2:30 p.m. in Branch 21.

All other conditions remain.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail amended to $6000.00 cash.

Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Brash, Br. 21. Defendant Junius S Moore in court with attorney Patrick T Earle.  Defendant Junius S Moore in custody.  William Levins for Marissa L. Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Marquis P., Michael P., Knova L., Jarquis P., Martha H., Terisha J., Joshua M., Immanuel P., Lacretia M., and Felicia M.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Junius S Moore in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Junius S Moore in custody.  Brittany C. Grayson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
